STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 13, 2023
Kara Lynn Mularz
Ogemaw/Roscommon County DHHS
444 E HOUGHTON AVE,
WEST BRANCH, MI, 48661-1130
RE: License#: CP650201338
Dear Kara Lynn Mularz:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 9/8/2023 . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5060.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12511 Termination
(1) When an agency terminates its independent living
services for a youth, the agency shall document all of
the following information in the case record within 30
calendar days of termination of its services:
(a) The reason for the termination.
Two of the two records of youth discharged from independent living did not
include the discharge documentation required by this rule completed within the 30
day time period. The youth were identified as being discharged 4/28/2023 and
9/8/2023 respectively.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:.
• Technical assistance was provided regarding documentation of social worker
notification regarding the completion/outcomes of special investigations.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• None

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. A
corrective action plan was submitted for the interim evaluation completed
12/2/2022. Areas of noncompliance were rule 324(8) and FOM 722-06 B. Neither
of these areas were identified as a repeat noncompliance as a part of this renewal
evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was a review of the agency's status in
completing the corrective action plan associated with the interim evaluation
completed 12/2/2022. A review of key performance indicators was also a part of
the assessment.
Financial Overview
N/A
Staff and Youth Interviews
Child Welfare staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Staff interviews
were positive and did not indicate any concerns.
Analyst interviews with youth were positive in nature and indicated appropriate
support and services are being provided.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is appropriately maintained and the storage of records is consistent
with compliance for licensing rules.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no safety alerts identified by the analyst. Comments from caregivers
and youth were generally positive and indicated appropriate support and services are
being provided.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
9/12/2023
_____________________________________
Mark Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 12, 2023
